author: John Harney
description: The UK government is moving to ban employers deploying nondisclosure agreements to muzzle workers who have been victims of misconduct on the job, the Guardian reported on Monday.
title: UK Is Moving to Ban NDAs to Hide Misconduct, Guardian Reports

author: Soo-Hyang Choi, Heesu Lee
description: South Korea said it will fix rules and regulations to address US demand to lower non-tariff barriers after President Donald Trump sent a letter to the Asian ally with a new August deadline to impose 25% rates.
title: South Korea Vows to Fix Regulations After Trump’s New Deadline

author: Zoe Tillman
description: Lawyers for Venezuelans sent to a prison in El Salvador claim new evidence “contradicts” the US government’s claims that Salvadoran officials, not the Trump administration, have legal authority over the men.
title: Lawyers Say New Evidence Challenges Trump on El Salvador Prisons

author: Brian Platt
description: Canada’s finance minister has asked members of cabinet to find billions of dollars in spending cuts as the government looks for ways to pay for a larger defense budget and capital projects.
title: Carney’s Cabinet Searches for Spending Cuts as Defense Bill Grows

author: Josh Wingrove
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Josh Wingrove looks at the president’s latest tariff threats and deadline. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Gives Himself Overtime Period to Cut Trade Deals

author: Alberto Nardelli, Jorge Valero
description: The European Union is seeking to conclude a preliminary trade deal with the US this week that would allow it to lock in a 10% tariff rate beyond an Aug. 1 deadline as they negotiate a permanent agreement.
title: EU Rushes to Conclude a Framework Trade Deal With US This Week

author: Ryan Chua
description: The US State Department is revoking the foreign terrorist designation of an Islamist rebel group that played a key role in downfall of Bashar Al-Assad’s regime in Syria, a week after President Donald Trump ordered the termination of sanctions on the country.
title: US Removes Terrorist Designation of Syrian Rebel Group HTS

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: Delivery of the Navy’s newest aircraft carrier, the USS John F. Kennedy, is likely to be pushed to March 2027 from this month because of production challenges, according to a newly disclosed budget document.
title: Newest US Navy Aircraft Carrier Faces 20-Month Delivery Delay

author: Elizabeth Rembert
description: It looked like the University of Notre Dame would be safe from a Republican proposal to raise taxes on college endowments.
title: Notre Dame Loses Protection From Endowment Tax in GOP Bill

author: Andrea Palasciano, Jorge Valero
description: The European Union will propose bilateral agreements with the UK and Canada as soon as the end of July, which would give them access to the bloc’s new €150 billion ($176 billion) loan fund for defense production, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU to Conclude Deals to Give UK, Canada Access to Defense Loans

author: Akayla Gardner
description: President Donald Trump will travel to Texas this week to survey first-hand the devastation from extreme floods that have left at least 91 people dead and scores still missing, the White House said.
title: Trump Plans Texas Trip This Week to Survey Flood Devastation

author: Michelle Kaske
description: President Donald Trump’s new budget bill is expected to push almost 12 million Americans off their health insurance, creating long-term financial issues for states and health-care providers, according to a S&P Global report.
title: S&P Sees Trump Tax Law Hurting State and Hospital Balance Sheets

author: Zoe Tillman
description: President Donald Trump’s escalating immigration crackdown has sparked a new round of lawsuits alleging illegal seizures by masked federal agents, as well as violations of US privacy rights and environmental laws.
title: Trump Immigration Crackdown Sparks Fresh Unlawful-Conduct Claims

author: Greg Ryan
description: Boston University is eliminating staff and reducing spending as the school grapples with the Trump administration’s push to reshape higher education and a pullback in research funding.
title: Boston University Cuts 120 Staff After Trump Funding Squeeze

author: Bob Van Voris
description: Planned Parenthood is suing the Trump administration over its new multitrillion-dollar tax and spending law, claiming it unconstitutionally targets the group by barring its health centers from receiving Medicaid reimbursement for reproductive health care.
title: Planned Parenthood Sues US Over Medicaid Funding Curb in New Law

author: Patrick Van Oosterom
description: Dutch flag carrier KLM agreed to lend pilots to the country’s air force, increasing the airline’s cooperation with the defense ministry after criticism it was poaching military aviators.
title: KLM to Lend Pilots to Dutch Air Force for Fighter Jet Duties

author: Myles Miller
description: Tom Homan, the border czar for President Donald Trump, said that immigration agents will ramp up arrests in New York City as part of a broader crackdown on sanctuary jurisdictions that limit cooperation with federal authorities.
title: Trump Immigration Enforcer Says ICE Will Boost Raids in New York

author: Brendan Murray, Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump announced tariffs of 25% on goods from Japan and South Korea beginning on Aug. 1, as he moved to impose unilateral rates on countries that have not yet secured trade deals with his administration.
title: Trump to Levy 25% Tariffs on Japan, South Korea in August

description: Operations at the Jawaharlal Nehru Port in Navi Mumbai, India. Photographer: Dhiraj Singh/Bloomberg
title: Trump Sends Letters With Tariff Terms to Japan, Korea

author: Denis Chabrol
description: Guyana’s main opposition group announced veteran politician Aubrey Norton as its presidential candidate, promising to use growing oil production to deliver higher wages and other social programs.
title: Guyana Opposition Taps Aubrey Norton as Its Presidential Candidate

author: Antony Sguazzin
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa is lurching from one crisis to another.
title: Fresh From One Crisis, South Africa’s Ramaphosa Faces Another

author: S'thembile Cele, Simone Iglesias, Mirette Magdy
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa stepped in to an escalating spat with Donald Trump over the US president’s threats targeting the BRICS group, saying that “it cannot be that might should now be right.”
title: Ramaphosa Blasts Back at Trump Over Threatened Tariffs on BRICS

author: Travis Waldron, Leda Alvim
description: Donald Trump accused Brazil of politically persecuting Jair Bolsonaro, launching a strident defense of the right-wing former president who is set to face trial on charges that he attempted a coup.
title: Trump Defends Bolsonaro as Trial on Coup Charges Looms

author: Arsalan Shahla
description: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian told Tucker Carlson his country remains open to talks with the US, but that it was difficult to trust Washington after its strikes last month.
title: Iran President Tells Tucker Carlson He’s Open to Talks With US

author: Mohammed Hatem
description: Yemen’s Houthis have claimed responsibility for an attack on a ship sailing through the Red Sea on Sunday, in their first strike on merchant shipping since December.
title: Houthis Say They Hit Red Sea Ship in First Attack This Year

author: Greg Sullivan
description: Former Russian Transportation Minister Roman Starovoit died in an apparent suicide, the country’s investigative committee said in a statement on Monday.
title: Russia Probes Suicide After Ex-Transport Minister Found Dead

author: Jorge Valero, Michal Kubala, Daniel Basteiro, Milda Seputyte
description: Ireland’s Paschal Donohoe is set to be reelected as president of the euro area’s group of finance ministers, retaining a leading role in the region’s efforts to enhance the profile of its common currency.
title: Donohoe to Keep Eurogroup Role to Push Currency’s Ascendancy

author: Akayla Gardner
description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said that he expected to meet with his Chinese counterpart in the coming weeks to advance discussions on trade and other issues between the world’s two largest economies.
title: Bessent Aims to Meet With Chinese Counterpart in Next Few Weeks

author: Eric Martin
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio is set to make his first trip to Asia as top US diplomat this week to discuss trade and security with regional counterparts who are looking to avoid President Donald Trump’s looming tariff increases.
title: Rubio Set to Make First Trip to Asia as Tariffs Deadline Looms

author: Joe Mayes
description: The UK government declined to rule out imposing a new tax on Britain’s wealthiest people, as Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves faces growing calls from prominent left-wing figures to introduce such a levy.
title: UK Declines to Rule Out Wealth Tax as Pressure Mounts on Reeves

author: Sofia Sorochinskaia
description: Russian air travelers faced major disruption over the past three days as carriers canceled, rescheduled and rerouted flights due to the threat from Ukrainian drones.
title: Russia Cancels or Delays More Than 2,000 Flights Due to Drones

author: Simone Iglesias, Mirette Magdy
description: BRICS officials kept their collective heads down on Monday morning as they awoke to an overnight threat by US President Donald Trump to penalize them for adopting policies he said were “anti-American.”
title: BRICS in Wait-and-See Mode After Trump Threatens Extra Tariffs

author: Irina Vilcu, Andra Timu
description: Romania’s government is rushing to approve a sweeping fiscal austerity package, provoking a potential no-confidence motion by surging far-right parties in parliament.
title: Romania Fast-Tracks Austerity Approval in Face of Resistance

author: Arun Devnath
description: Bangladesh’s interim government is anticipating a favorable resolution in trade negotiations with the US, after being among the hardest hit by President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs in April.
title: Bangladesh Expects ‘Positive Outcome’ With US on Trade Deal

author: Alicia A. Caldwell, Elena Mejia
description: The expansion has added thousands of beds to ICE capacity, as the department prepares for an influx of cash from Congress
title: Trump Administration Adds 60 Facilities for Detained Migrants

author: Jorge Valero, Michael Nienaber, Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union said it’s nearing the framework of a trade agreement with the US after the head of the bloc’s executive arm, Ursula von der Leyen, held a call with President Donald Trump on Sunday.
title: EU Says It’s Closing In on the Framework of a Trade Deal With US

author: Simon Marks, David Herbling
description: The streets of downtown Nairobi were deserted and many store fronts were soldered shut as workers and traders stayed away on fears that protests demanding the removal of President William Ruto may turn violent.
title: Commerce Halts as Kenya Police Barricade Capital From Protesters

author: Alan Crawford
description: Expansion of the club to include 10 members is enhancing its economic clout in a US-dominated world.
title: BRICS Is Getting Increasingly Hard to Ignore

author: Alex Vasquez, Maya Averbuch
description: As Mexican courts embrace a new era following the nation’s first-ever election of judges, the Supreme Court’s incoming chief says one of his priorities will be to ensure fairness across the board — and that includes company tax obligations.
title: Mexico’s Next Top Judge Says Company Taxes Should Be Clear Cut

author: Francine Lacqua, Joao Lima
description: Portuguese Finance Minister Joaquim Miranda Sarmento said he sees the European Union and the US reaching an agreement with tariffs potentially below 10% that would help keep trade flowing.
title: Portugal Sees EU, US Reaching Deal With ‘Very Low’ Tariffs

author: Daryna Krasnolutska
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy discussed replacing the current ambassador to the US during his phone call with President Donald Trump on Friday, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Zelenskiy Spoke With Trump About Replacing Ukraine’s Envoy to US

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand’s government will withdraw a controversial bill to legalize casinos from parliament following mounting public opposition and a fresh bout of political turmoil that has reduced the ruling coalition’s majority.
title: Thailand Backtracks on Casino Bill as Political Turmoil Deepens

author: Andreo Calonzo
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. will not oppose proposals to limit and tax online gambling, according to his press officer.
title: Philippines’ Marcos Open to Limiting, Taxing Online Gambling

author: Ugur Yilmaz
description: Turkey launched an investigation into the main opposition party’s leader and arrested more of ts mayors, in a widening crackdown that’s likely to stoke investor anxiety over risks to the rule of law and political stability.
title: Pressure on Turkey Opposition Grows With Probe Into Party Leader

author: Jamie Nimmo, Irina Anghel, Jennifer Creery
description: Before taking office last July, UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves met business leaders over a series of breakfasts that became known as the smoked salmon and scrambled eggs offensive. British bosses were clamoring for change after 14 years of rule by the opposition Conservative party, and her pitch went down well.
title: UK Business Leaders Are ‘Struggling to See What’s Business-Friendly’ About Labour

author: Lionel Laurent
description: The era of greenwashing is giving way to defense-washing. It won't make Europe stronger.
title: Italy's Bridge to Nowhere Shows Defense-Boom Risks

author: Alan Wong, James Mayger
description: President Donald Trump said he would put an additional 10% tariff on any country aligning themselves with “the Anti-American policies of BRICS,” injecting further uncertainty into global trade as the US continues to negotiate levies with many trading partners.
title: Trump Threatens 10% Tariff for ‘Anti-American’ BRICS Alignment
